thread.title: Pinkman does it again, wins Kentucky Futurity
thread.title_full: Pinkman does it again, wins Kentucky Futurity

title: Pinkman does it again, wins Kentucky Futurity
text:
Pinkman does it again, wins Kentucky Futurity AP 
Oct 10, 2015 at 8:04p ET + Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 8:04p ET 
LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) Pinkman cruised at the start and took over in the stretch to win the $527,000 Kentucky Futurity for 3-year-old trotters at The Red Mile on Saturday. 
The winning margin was 1 1/4 lengths over long shot Crescent Fashion, with Pinkman covering the mile in 1:51.2. French Laundry was third. 
The triumph gave trainer Jimmy Takter's Pinkman wins in two of the three trotting triple crown races. Pinkman won the Hambletonian at the Meadowlands, but Habitat won the Yonkers Trot, the second leg. 
Pinkman raced in third for nearly three-quarters of a mile before challenging leader Crazy Wow on the final turn. He pulled away from the field in the stretch before holding off Crescent Fashion to win. 
Sent off at 2-1 odds, Pinkman paid $6.20 to win. Pinkman has won 11 of 15 races this year and earned $1.75 million.
